intro: Ipomoea angulata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf morning glory, is a flowering vine native to Central and South America. It features heart-shaped, broad leaves that are often hairy and can grow up to 15 cm in length. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet, typically opening in the morning. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist woodlands or along stream banks. The species is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
